verses.verse: And Joseph <WH3130> fell <WH5307> on his father's <WH1> face, <WH6440> and wept <WH1058> on him, and kissed <WH5401> him.
And Joseph <WH3130> commanded <WH6680> his servants <WH5650> the physicians <WH7495> to embalm <WH2590> his father: <WH1> and the physicians <WH7495> embalmed <WH2590> Israel. <WH3478>

And forty <WH705> days <WH3117> were fulfilled <WH4390> for him; for so <WH3651> are fulfilled <WH4390> the days <WH3117> of those which are embalmed: <WH2590> and the Egyptians <WH4714> mourned <WH1058> for him three score <WH7657> and ten days. <WH3117>

And when the days <WH3117> of his mourning <WH1086> were past, <WH5674> Joseph <WH3130> spoke <WH1696> to the house <WH1004> of Pharaoh, <WH6547> saying, <WH559> If <WH518> now <WH4994> I have found <WH4672> grace <WH2580> in your eyes, <WH5869> speak, <WH1696> I pray <WH4994> you, in the ears <WH241> of Pharaoh, <WH6547> saying, <WH559>

My father <WH1> made me swear, <WH7650> saying, <WH559> See, <WH2009> I die: <WH4191> in my grave <WH6913> which <WH834> I have dig <WH3738> for me in the land <WH776> of Canaan, <WH3667> there <WH8033> shall you bury <WH6912> me. Now <WH6258> therefore let me go <WH5927> up, I pray <WH4994> you, and bury <WH6912> my father, <WH1> and I will come <WH7725> again. <WH7725>
And Pharaoh <WH6547> said, <WH559> Go <WH5927> up, and bury <WH6912> your father, <WH1> according as he made you swear. <WH7650>

And Joseph <WH3130> went <WH5927> up to bury <WH6912> his father: <WH1> and with him went <WH5927> up all <WH3605> the servants <WH5650> of Pharaoh, <WH6547> the elders <WH2205> of his house, <WH1004> and all <WH3605> the elders <WH2205> of the land <WH776> of Egypt, <WH4714>

And all <WH3605> the house <WH1004> of Joseph, <WH3130> and his brothers, <WH251> and his father's <WH1> house: <WH1004> only <WH7535> their little <WH2945> ones, and their flocks, <WH6629> and their herds, <WH1241> they left <WH5800> in the land <WH776> of Goshen. <WH1657>
And there went <WH5927> up with him both <WH1571> chariots <WH7393> and horsemen: <WH6571> and it was a very <WH3966> great <WH3515> company. <WH4264>

And they came <WH935> to the threshing floor <WH1637> of Atad, <WH329> which <WH834> is beyond <WH5676> Jordan, <WH3383> and there <WH8033> they mourned <WH5594> with a great <WH1419> and very <WH3966> sore <WH3515> lamentation: <WH4553> and he made <WH6213> a mourning <WH60> for his father <WH1> seven <WH7651> days. <WH3117>

And when the inhabitants <WH3427> of the land, <WH776> the Canaanites, <WH3669> saw <WH7200> the mourning <WH60> in the floor <WH1637> of Atad, <WH329> they said, <WH559> This <WH2088> is a grievous <WH3515> mourning <WH60> to the Egyptians: <WH4714> why <WH5921> <WH3651> the name <WH8034> of it was called <WH7121> Abelmizraim, <WH67> which <WH834> is beyond <WH5676> Jordan. <WH3383>
And his sons <WH1121> did <WH6213> to him according <WH3651> as he commanded <WH6680> them:

For his sons <WH1121> carried <WH5375> him into the land <WH776> of Canaan, <WH3667> and buried <WH6912> him in the cave <WH4631> of the field <WH7704> of Machpelah, <WH4375> which <WH834> Abraham <WH85> bought <WH7069> with the field <WH7704> for a possession <WH272> of a burial plot <WH6913> of Ephron <WH6085> the Hittite, <WH2850> before <WH5921> <WH6440> Mamre. <WH4471>

And Joseph <WH3130> returned <WH7725> into Egypt, <WH4714> he, and his brothers, <WH251> and all <WH3605> that went <WH5927> up with him to bury <WH6912> his father, <WH1> after <WH310> he had buried <WH6912> his father. <WH1>

And when Joseph's <WH3130> brothers <WH251> saw <WH7200> that their father <WH1> was dead, <WH4191> they said, <WH559> Joseph <WH3130> will peradventure <WH3863> hate <WH7852> us, and will certainly requite <WH7725> us all <WH3605> the evil <WH7451> which <WH834> we did <WH1580> to him.
And they sent a messenger <WH6680> to Joseph, <WH3130> saying, <WH559> Your father <WH1> did command <WH6680> before <WH6440> he died, <WH4194> saying, <WH559>

So <WH3541> shall you say <WH559> to Joseph, <WH3130> Forgive, <WH5375> I pray <WH577> you now, <WH4994> the trespass <WH6588> of your brothers, <WH251> and their sin; <WH2403> for they did <WH1580> to you evil: <WH7451> and now, <WH4994> we pray <WH4994> you, forgive <WH5375> the trespass <WH6588> of the servants <WH5650> of the God <WH430> of your father. <WH1> And Joseph <WH3130> wept <WH1058> when they spoke <WH1696> to him.
And his brothers <WH251> also <WH1571> went <WH3212> and fell <WH5307> down before his face; <WH6440> and they said, <WH559> Behold, <WH2009> we be your servants. <WH5650>
And Joseph <WH3130> said <WH559> to them, Fear <WH3372> not: for am I in the place of God? <WH430>

But as for you, you thought <WH2803> evil <WH7451> against <WH5921> me; but God <WH430> meant <WH2803> it to good, <WH2896> to bring <WH6213> to pass, <WH6213> as it is this <WH2088> day, <WH3117> to save <WH2421> much <WH7227> people <WH5971> alive. <WH2421>
Now <WH6258> therefore fear <WH3372> you not: I will nourish <WH3557> you, and your little <WH2945> ones. And he comforted <WH5162> them, and spoke <WH1696> kindly <WH5921> <WH3820> to them.
And Joseph <WH3130> dwelled <WH3427> in Egypt, <WH4714> he, and his father's <WH1> house: <WH1004> and Joseph <WH3130> lived <WH2421> an hundred <WH3967> and ten <WH6235> years. <WH8141>

And Joseph <WH3130> saw <WH7200> Ephraim's <WH669> children <WH1121> of the third <WH8029> generation: the children <WH1121> also <WH1571> of Machir <WH4353> the son <WH1121> of Manasseh <WH4519> were brought <WH3205> up on Joseph's <WH3130> knees. <WH1290>

And Joseph <WH3130> said <WH559> to his brothers, <WH251> I die: <WH4191> and God <WH430> will surely visit <WH6485> you, and bring <WH5927> you out of this <WH2063> land <WH776> to the land <WH776> which <WH834> he swore <WH7650> to Abraham, <WH85> to Isaac, <WH3327> and to Jacob. <WH3290>

And Joseph <WH3130> took an oath <WH7650> of the children <WH1121> of Israel, <WH3478> saying, <WH559> God <WH430> will surely visit <WH6485> you, and you shall carry <WH5927> up my bones <WH6106> from hence. <WH2088>

So Joseph <WH3130> died, <WH4191> being an hundred <WH3967> and ten <WH6235> years <WH8141> old: <WH1121> and they embalmed <WH2590> him, and he was put <WH3455> in a coffin <WH727> in Egypt. <WH4714>
